thread.title: A Chair Built for Privacy
thread.title_full: A Chair Built for Privacy - WSJ

author: Sarah Medford
title: A Chair Built for Privacy
text:
1 COMMENTS MOST PEOPLE THINK of sofas as convivial furnishings, basically party boats with upholstery. But the famously exacting designer Michael Anastassiades took a different tack in his new two-seater for British furniture brand SCP. “Today we are constantly interrupted, even in the virtual environment,” said the London-based designer. “We need places to be private.” This boxy beauty—made of oak-veneered beech wood and upholstered in wool or the fabric of your choice—lets you escape in plain sight, alone or with a friend. SCP by Michael Anastassiades Rochester Sofa, and Ottoman, from $7,845 and $1,580, respectively, the Future Perfect, 212-473-2500
